kanuni za kudumu za bunge karatasi za ura zilizokwishatumika hazitaon eshwa kwa mtu yeyote na katibu isipokuwa kwa mujibu wa azimio la bunge baada ya hoja ya kutaka zi oneshwe kupitishwa
sehemu ya kumi malalamiko dhidi ya matokeo ya kura malalamiko dhidi ya matokeo ya kura 
iwapo mgombea yeyote hataridhika na matokeo ya uchaguzi au jinsi uchaguzi ulivyofanywa atawasilisha malalamiko yake kwa spika ndani ya siku moja tangu tarehe ya uchaguzi na spika ataitisha kamati ya kanuni za bunge kushughulikia malalamiko hayo mapema iwezekanavyo
kanuni za kudumu za bunge nyongeza ya tatu the east african legislative assembly election rules made under standing order and article of the treaty for the establishment of east african community part preliminary rules citation 
these rules may be cited as the east african legislative assembly election rules
interpretation 
in these rules all the parliamentary words and expressions used shall have the same meaning assigned to them in the parliamentary standing orders and unless the context requires otherwise candidate means person who is nominated to stand for election to the east african legislative assembly as provided for in rule of these rules election means an election to the east african legislative assembly nomination means nomination as candidate to stand for election to the east africa legislative assembly returning officer means the clerk of the national assembly treaty means the treaty for the establishment of the east african community and voter means member of parliament present and voting during the elect ion
kanuni za kudumu za bunge part ii qualification of candidates qualification of candidate 
person shall be qualified to be candidate for election to the east african legislative assembly who he is qualified to be elected in accordance with article of the treaty
part iii nomination of candidates nomination of candidate 
 where an election is to be held the returning officer shall by notice published in the gazette appoint nomination day for that election
 the returning officer shall give at least fourteen days notice of such nomination day
 in ord er to be validly nominated as candidate for the east african legislative assembly election person must be nominated in transparent and democratic manner by the political party which is sponsoring him
 the nomination shall be in the prescribed form signed by the candidate and by the secretary general of the party nominating him and shall contain the following particulars a the name educational qualifications address and occupation of the candidate and b certificate by the candidate that he is willing and otherwise qualified to stand for election
 every nomination paper shall be accompanied by the following documents a proof of citizenship of the united republic of tanzania provided by the immigration department validity of nomination kanuni za kudumu za bunge cap
 b detailed biographical information relating to the candidate signed by the candidate himself which shall enable the retunring officer to determine whether or not the candidate has proven experience or interest in consolidating and furthering the aims and objectives of the community in terms of article of the treaty and c an extract of the nomination proceedings of the party organ which approved the final nomination of the candidate signed by the chairman and secretary of that organ which shall enable the retur ning officer to determine whether or not the relevant political party s proceedings were democratic and transparent in terms of the political parties act
 the candidate or an official of the party nominating him shall deliver the nomination papers to the returning officer at his office in dodoma not later than four o clock in the afternoon of the nomination day
 any political party which is entilted to sponsor candidates may submit to the returning officer the names of three candidates for each vacant seat in the following relevant groups group a women candidates group b zanzibar candidates group c minority parties candidates and group d mainland candidates
non refundable deposit 
candidate or an official of the party nominating him shall at the time of delivering the nomination paper deposit non refundable deposit of fifty thousand shilli ngs to cover for the cost of election expenses
kanuni za kudumu za bunge rejection of nomination papers 
objections may be made by the returning officer to the nomination of candidate if it is apparent to him from the contents of the nomination papers that the candidate is not qualified to stand for election the returning officer shall forthwith reject the nomination papers of that candidate
part iv election and voting procedure election day 
the returning officer shall by notice published in the gazette appoint an election day which shall be not more than seven days after nomination day provided that such election day shall be day when the national assembly is sitting in ordinary session
withdrawal of candidature 
 candidate may withdraw his candidature by notice in writing signed and delivered by him to the returning officer and copy to the secretary general of the party sponsoring him not later than four o clock in the afternoon of the day following nomination day thereafter no withdraws shall be accepted
 where any candidate dies after four o clock in the afternoon of nomination day and before election day the election process will continue undisturbed
campaign by candidates 
 an aspiring candidate may introduce himself to the voters and seek their support even before nomination day and may continue to do so after nomination day
 before the votes are cast on election day each candidate will be permitted to appear before the voters duly assembled in an ordinary sitting of the house and address them in english for such kanuni za kudumu za bunge length of time and answer such number of questions if any as may be determined by the speaker for that purpose
supervision of the voting processs 
 the voting shall be conducted under the general supervision of the returning officer
 the returning officer shall issue only one ballot paper to each voter
 the ballot paper shall contain the names of all candidates arranged alphabetically in the following groups group a women candidates group b zanzibar candidates group c minority parties candidates and group d mainland candidates
 voter shall be required to cast specified number of votes to be announced by the speaker in each of the groups
 on receiving ballot paper each voter shall secretl record his votes by putting mark against the names of the nine candidates he wishes to vote for
 each voter shall be required to cast as many votes as there are vacancies otherwise his whole ballot paper will be regarded as spoilt
 voter who has accidentally spoiled his ballot paper while the voting is still in progress may surrender the spoilt ballot paper to the returning officer and obtain replacement thereof
votes counting agents 
 when all the voters have casted their votes the speaker shall appoint two counting agents one from the ruling party and the other from the minority benches to act as counting agents for all the candidates
kanuni za kudumu za bunge immediately afte all the ballots have votes been collected the returning officer with the assistance of clerk assistants and before the two counting agents as witnesses shall count the votes so casted
 in order to enable the national assembly to proceed with oth er business the counting of votes shall take place outside the assembly chamber in room designated by the clerk for that purpose within the precincts of the assembly
announcement of elections results 
when the votes have already been counted and the results of the election has been ascertained the returning officer shall a report to the assembly the election results together with the number of votes recorded for each candidate in each group and b announce to the assembly the names of nine persons receiving the majority number of votes in each group and shall declare those persons to have been elected as members of the east african legislative assembly
custody of ballot papers 
 the returning officer shall ensure the safe custody of all ballot papers and other documents relating and pertaining to the conduct of the election
 the returning officer shall cause all documents to which this paragraph applies to be destroyed after the expiration of six months from the election day unless otherwise directed by an order of the high court arising from any proceedings of petition relating to the election
kanuni za kudumu za bunge part annulment and avoidance of election annulment and avoidance of election 
pursuant to the provisions of article of the treaty the election of candidate as member of the east african legislative assembly may be declared null and void only on an election petition
grounds for annulment and avoidance of election 
the procedure jurisdiction and grounds for declaring the election of such member null and void shall be the same as those provided by law for election petitions in respect of members of the parliament of the united republic of tanzania
part vi miscellaneous matters not provided for 
 if any matter or thing arises which is not specifically provided for in these rules the speaker shall make ruling directing what is to be done in respect of that matter or thing
 in making such ruling the speaker shall be guided by the practices and procedures normally followed in similar situations with regard to parliamentary elections
kanuni za kudumu za bunge nyongeza ya nne the submission of regular reports to the parliament of tanzania by the tanzania members of the east african legislative assembly regulations made under article of the treaty for the establishment of the east african community citation 
these regulations may be cited as the submission of regular reports to the parliament of the united republic of tanzania by the members of the east african legislative assembly regulations
interpretation 
 these regulations are made to provide for procedure for the members of the east african legislative assembly hailing from tanzania to submit regular reports to the parliament of the united republic of tanzania
 these regulations shall apply to members of east african legislative assem bly hailing from the united republic of tanzania
presentation of annual report 
the members of the east african legislative assembly shall present an annual report of the activities of the east african legislative assembly for the relevant year to the parliament of the united republic of tanzania through its standing committee respo nsible for foreign affairs
kanuni za kudumu za bunge time of presentation 
the annual reports shall be presented at regular meeting of the standing committee at time to be determined by the chairman of the committee
presentation of special report and consultations 
the tanzania embers of the east african legislative assembly may if they consider it desirable to do so present any special report or make any appropriate consultations with the committee on any matter which is relevant to the work of the east afri can legislative assembly at any other scheduled meeting of the committee
attendance and laying of reports on the table 
 all tanzania members of the east african legislative assembly shall be present at the time of presentation of any report
 all such reports shall subsequently be laid on the table of the house and shall be debated upon
kanuni za kudumu za bunge nyongeza ya tano the pan african parliament election rules made under standing order and article of the protocol to the treaty for establishing of the african economic community relating to the pan african parliament part preliminary rules citation 
these rules may be cited as the pan african parliament election rules and shall come into operation on the day of their adoption by resolution of the national assembly rules
interpretation 
in these rules unless the context requires otherwise candidate means member of parliament who is duly nominated to stand for election to the pan african parliament as provided for in rule of these rules election means the election to embership of the pan african parliament election day means the day on which the election of members of the pan african parliament is set to be conducted nomination means nomination as candidate to stand for election to the pan african parliament kanuni za kudumu za bunge nomination day means the day which shall by notice published by the returning officer be set to be the last day for receiving application forms from candidates nominator means member of parliament of the parliament of the united republic of tanzania entitled to vote who nominates and supports candidate who aspires to stand and contest for election to the pan african parliament qualification means the qualification which entitles person to stand and contest for election to the pan african parliament returning officer means the clerk of the national assembly speaker means the speaker of the national assembly and voter means member of parliament of the united republic of tanzania present and voting during the election
part ii qualification of candidates qualification of candidates 
no person shall be qualified to be candidate for election to the pan african parliament unless he or she is member of parliament of the united republic of tanzania and is fluent in any of the languages approved for use in the proceedings of the pan african parliament
part iii nomination procedure appointment of nomination day 
 where election of members of the pan african parliament is to be held the returning officer shall by written notice circulated to all members of the parliament of the united republic of kanuni za kudumu za bunge tanzania appoint nomination day for that election which mus be day during any period when the national assembly is in ordinary session
 the returning officer shall give at least seven days notice of such nomination day
nomination procedure 
the following shall be the procedure for the nomination of candidates that a in the case of general election of all the five members of the pan african parliament representing tanzania the candidates will be nominated in accordance with he following groups group a women candidates group b zanzibar candidates group c mainland candidates and group d minority parties candidates
provided that whereas group shall be reserved for women candidates only the remaining groups shall be open to both men and women candidates
b the number of candidates to be elected in each group shall be as follows group a one candidate
group b one candidate
group c two candidates
group d one candidate
c in the case of by election to fill casual vacancy candidates will be nominated only in respect of the group in which the vacancy has occurred and d no candidate may be nominated for more than one specified group
kanuni za kudumu za bunge 
 in order to be validly nominated to stand as candidate for election to pan african parliament person shall be nominated and supported in writing by not less than ten nominators who are entitled to vote at that election
nominator may nominate up to four cand idates one for each of the four groups
 the nomination shall be in the prescribed form obtainable from the returning officer and shall contain working experience of the candidate
 the time for receipt by the returning officer of nominatio forms duly completed by the aspiring candidates shall expire at four o clock in the afternoon of the nomination day and soon thereafter the returning officer shall give written notification to all members of parliament of the complete list of the all andidates who have been validly nominated for the election in respect of each of the four groups
 after being validly nominated candidate may withdraw his candidature by notice in writing signed and delivered by him to the returning officer not later than four o clock in the afternoon of the day following the nomination day thereafter no withdrawals shall be accepted
 where any candidate dies at any time after nomination day and before election day the election process shall continue undisturbed
 after being validly nominated candidate may conduct his or her election campaign
nomination of candidates part iv election procedure election day 
the returning officer shall by written notice circulated to all members of parliament kanuni za kudumu za bunge appoint an election day which must be day on which the national assembly is sitting in ordinary session and shall be not more than five days after nomination day
voting process 
the voting process shall be conducted under the general supervision of the speaker provided that if the speaker himself or herself is candidate he or she shall vacate the chair before the commencement of the election proceedings
candidates to address voters 
before the voting exercise takes place on election day each candidate shall be given an opportunity to appear before the voters assembled in an ordinary sitting of the national assembly and address them in english for such length of time and answer such number of questions if any as may be determined by the speaker for that purpose
voting procedure 
immediately after address of the candidates voting shall commence and proceed as follows a only one ballot paper shall be issued to each voter b the ballot paper shall contain all names of the candidates arranged in alphabetical order for each of the groups and c each voter shall be required to cast the exact number of votes equal to the number of persons to be elected in ach group
casting of votes 
 on receiving ballot paper each voter shall secretly record his or her five votes by placing tick in the space provide against the name of each candidate and thereafter shall place the ballot paper in the ballot box
kanuni za kudumu za bunge voter who has accidentally spoiled his or her ballot paper while voting is still in progress may surrender the spoilt ballot paper to returning officer and obtain replacement thereof
appointment of counting gents and counting of votes 
 immediately after all the votes have been placed in the ballot boxes and before the ballot boxes are removed from the assembly chamber for counting the votes the speaker shall appoint one counting agent for the candidates in each of the groups
provided that any candidate who wishes to appoint his or her own counting agent may do so by submitting the name of that agent to the speaker immediately after the appointments by the speaker have been announced
 the counting of votes shall be done by such number of officers of the assembly as may be appointed by the returning officer and shall be witnessed by the counting agents
place for counting of votes 
in order to enable the national assembly to proceed with other business scheduled for that day the counting of votes shall take place in room designated by the speaker for that purpose within the precincts of the assembly
declaration of election results 
after the countig of votes is complete and the results ascertained and certified by the returning officer and the counting agents the returning officer shall immediately submit the results to the speaker who shall a report to the assembly the results of the election together with the number of votes recorded for each candidate in each of the kanuni za kudumu za bunge groups and b announce to the assembly the names of five candidates receiving the highest number of votes in each group and shall declare those candidates to have been elected as members of the pan african parliament
custody of ballot papers 
 the returning officer shall ensure the safe custody of all ballot papers and other documents pertaining to the election
 the returning officer shall cause all documents to which this rule applies to be destroyed after the expiration of six months from the electio day
part miscellaneous matters not provided for 
 where anything arises which is not specifically provided for in these rules the speaker shall make ruling directing what is to be done
 in making ruling referred under sub rule the speaker shall be guided by the procedures and practices normally followed in similar situations with regard to parliamentary elections
kanuni za kudumu za bunge nyongeza ya sita mwongozo kuhusu maswali kwa waziri mkuu chini ya kanuni ya na maelezo ya jumla 
 kipindi cha maswali kwa waziri mkuu kikishaanza bungeni hakitakatishwa wala kusitishwa isipokuwa kutokana na sababu maalum ya dharura
 maswali yatakayoulizwa kwa waziri mkuu wakati wa kipindi cha maswali kwa waziri mkuu yatakuwa ni yale yanayohusu sera za serikali au jambo lolote lenye manufaa na maslahi kwa jamii na taifa lililo chini ya madaraka na mamlaka ya kazi ya waziri mkuu
 maswali kwa waziri mkuu yatakuwa ni ya papo kwa papo yaani yataulizwa bila kutolewa taarifa na yatajibiwa kwa mdomo papo kwa papo
 waziri mkuu hatalazimika kujibu swali lolote linalohitaji takwimu au majibu yanayohitaji utafiti
utaratibu wa kupata fursa ya kumuuliza waziri mkuu swali 
bila ya kuathiri masharti ya fasili ya ya mwongozo huu wabunge wanaotaka kumuuliza waziri mkuu swali wakati wa kipindi cha maswali kwa waziri mkuu watawasilisha majina yao kwa katibu kabl ya saa 
 asubuhi siku hiyo ya maswali kwa waziri mkuu
utaratibu wa kuuliza maswali kwa waziri mkuu 
 kipindi cha maswali kwa waziri mkuu kinapoanza bungeni spika atamwita kiongozi wa kanuni za kudumu za bunge kambi rasmi ya walio wachache bungeni na kumpa fursa ya kwanza ya kumuuliza waziri mkuu swali
 baada ya kuuliza na kujibiwa swali lake la kwanza kiongozi wa kambi rasmi ya walio wachache bungeni anaweza kumuuliza waziri mkuu swali moja la kudai ufafanuzi
 mbunge yeyote atakayepata fursa ya kumuul iza waziri mkuu swali na kujibiwa anaweza kumuuliza waziri mkuu swali lingine moja la ufafanuzi
 endapo orodha ya majina ya wauliza maswali kwa waziri mkuu kwa siku hiyo itafikia mwisho lakini muda wa kipindi cha maswali kwa waziri mkuu bado haujam alizika spika anaweza kutoa fursa kwa mbunge yeyote ambaye hakupangwa katika orodha hiyo kumuuliza waziri mkuu swali
 mbunge anayetaka kupewa fursa na spika kwa mujibu wa fasili ya atasimama mahala pake ili spika amwone na kumwita
 mbunge yeyote aliyepata fursa ya kumuuliza waziri mkuu swali wakati wa kipindi cha maswali kwa waziri mkuu atakuwa na haki pia ya kuuliza swali lake lililowekwa kwenye orodha ya shughuli za siku hiyo wakati wa kipindi cha maswali ya bunge kitakapo wadia
maswali na majibu kwa waziri mkuu 
maswali na majibu katika kipindi cha maswali kwa waziri mkuu yawe mafupi
kanuni za kudumu za bunge nyongeza ya saba mwongozo wa kusimamia ukusanyaji na utoaji wa habari za bunge chini ya kanuni ya sehemu ya kwanza utangulizi maelezo ya jumla 
mwongozo wa kusimamia ukusanyaji na utoaji wa habari za bunge una lengo la kukuza demokrasia na uwazi katika shughuli za bunge kudumisha mahusiano na wananchi kupitia vyombo vya habari na kuainisha majukumu ambayo yanatekelezwa na kamati kwa uwazi na faragha
sehemu ya pili misingi na masharti ya utoaji wa habari za bunge misingi ya ukusanyaji na utoaji wa habari za bunge 
bila ya kuathiri masharti ya sheria zinazosimamia ukusanyaji na utoaji wa habari ukusanyaji na utoaji wa habari za bunge utazingatia misingi ifuatayo a haki uwazi na uwajibikaji wa bunge na wabunge b kutoingilia maisha binafsi na faragha ya mbunge c kutoingilia uhuru wa bunge na wabunge katika kutekeleza majukumu kanuni za kudumu za bunge yao d kuhakikisha kuwa habari zinazotolewa zinazingatia ukweli na hazilengi kupotosha jamii na e kuhakikisha kuwa habari zinazotolewa haziegemei upande wowote na hazina ubaguzi
matangazo ya moja kwa moja kurushwa na studio ya bunge 
 matangazo ya moja kwa moja ya vikao vya bunge na vikao vya kamati yatatolewa na studio ya bunge
 bila ya kuathiri masharti ya fasili ya chombo cha habari au mwandishi wa habari anaweza kuomba kurusha matangazo ya moja kwa moja ya vikao vya bunge yaliyoandaliwa na studio ya bunge
 kwa madhumuni ya utekelezaji bora wa masharti ya fasili ya chombo cha habari kitarusha matangazo bila mabadiliko na kama yalivyopokelewa kutoka studio ya bunge
upigaji picha katika ukumbi na maeneo ya bunge 
 bila ya kuathiri masharti ya kanuni ya ya mwongozo huu upigaji wa picha katika ukumbi wa bunge na maeneo ya bunge utazingatia heshima utu na staha
 vifaa vitakavyotumika katika upigaji picha vitaidhinishwa na katibu kabla ya kupiga picha katika ukumbi wa bunge na maeneo ya bunge
 mpiga picha anakapokuwa kwenye ukumbi wa bu nge ataelekeza kamera yake kwa spika au mbunge anayezungumza wakati huo
 bila ya kuathiri masharti ya fasili ya mpiga picha anaweza kuacha kuelekeza kamera kwa spika au mbunge na kuelekeza sehemu nyingine pale ambapo kuna tukio jingine linalohu siana na shughuli inayoendelea
kanuni za kudumu za bunge maeneo yasiyoruhusiwa kupiga picha 
 upigaji picha hautaruhusiwa katika maeneo yafuatayo a maeneo ya ukaguzi wa usalama b benki mgahawa na zahanati ya bunge c maegesho ya magari d kumbi zote za kupumzikia wageni e jengo la utawala na f maeneo mengine yatakayoamuliwa na katibu
 bila kuathiri masharti ya fasili ya upigaji picha katika maeneo hayo unaweza kuruhusiwa kwa kibali kitakachotolewa na katibu
sehemu ya tatu masharti kuhusu upatikanaji wa habari kutoka kwenye vikao vya kamati za bunge majukumu yatakayote kelezwa kwa uwazi 
majukumu yatakayotekelezwa kwa uwazi na ambayo yanaweza kutolewa kwa waandishi wa habari bila kuleta athari kwenye maamuzi ya kamati ni yafuatayo a mambo ya kawaida ya kuisimamia na kuishauri serikali kama vile kutathmini utekelezaji wa miradi mbalimbal ya maendeleo b maoni yanayotolewa na wadau wanaoalikwa na kamati kulingana na utaratibu uliowekwa na bunge c majukumu ambayo yana lenga kuwapatia wabunge elimu emina makongamano na ziara za mafunzo na kanuni za kudumu za bunge d maelezo yanayotolewa na serikali kwenye kamati za bunge kwa lengo la kutoa ufafanuzi kwa wabunge wanapotekeleza majukumu ya kamati
majukumu yatakayote kelezwa kwa faragha 
majukumu yatakayofanywa kwa faragha yatahusu mambo yote ambayo habari zake zikitolewa kwa waandishi wa habari kabla ya wakati wake yanaweza kuathiri maamuzi ya kamati na pia kusababisha ukiukwaji wa kanuni za bunge ni yafuatayo a kazi zote zinazopelekwa kwenye kamati na spika ili kupata mapendekezo ya hatua za kuchukuliwa na bunge b shughuli zote za uchambuzi wa oja mbalimbali zilizoko mbele ya kamati c shughuli zote zinazotekelezwa kwa utaratibu wa kiuchunguzi d shughuli zote za kiuchunguzi zenye utaratibu uliowekewa masharti zinazotekelezwa na kamati e shughuli zote zinazotekelezwa na kamati ndogo na f kamati zinapofanya ziara za kiuchunguzi
kamati zinazotekeleza majukumu kwa faragha 
 kamati zitakazotekeleza majukumu yake kwa faragha ni kamati ya uongozi kamati ya kanuni za bunge kamati ya haki maadili na madaraka ya bunge kamati ya mambo ya nje ulinzi na usalama kamati ya hesabu za serikali kamati ya hesabu ya serikali za itaa na kamati ya bajeti
 majukumu yenye uwazi wenye mipaka ni yale yanayotekelezwa na kamati za kiuchunguzi zifuatazo zenye utaratibu uliowekewa masharti kanuni za kudumu za bunge a kamati ya hesabu za serikali b kamati ya hesabu za serikali za mitaa c kamati ya mambo ya nje ulinzi na usalama na d kamati ya bajeti
 kwa madhumuni ya kanuni hii taarifa zenye uwazi wenye mipaka zitajumuisha a taarifa ya mdhibiti na mkaguzi mkuu wa hesabu za serikali inapowasilishwa bungeni inakuwa wazi kwa vyombo vya habari na b mchakato wa kamati hizi kuwahoji maafisa masuuli kuhusiana na taarifa ya mdhibiti na mkaguzi mkuu wa hesabu za serikali
utakuwa wazi hadi hatua ambayo kamati inataka kufanya maamuzi ya kutoa mapendekezo ya hatua za kuchukuliwa na bunge ambapo kamati itafanya kazi zake kwa faragha
 iwapo mchakato wa kuhoji maafisa masuuli unaofanywa chini ya fasili ya b utakuwa ni wa kiuchunguzi mchakato utafanyika kwa faragha
 kamati zinapofanya ziara kwa lengo la kujifunza au kujielimisha shughuli zake zitafany wa kwa uwazi na wajumbe wa kamati watakuwa na uhuru wa kutoa maoni yao ya jumla kwenye vyombo vya habari
 maoni ya wajumbe wa kamati chini ya fasili ya yatakuwa ni yale ambayo hayaathiri maamuzi yatakayotolewa kwa faragha na kamati baada ya ziara yake
 waandishi wa habari katika kutoa taarifa zinazotokana na maoni ya wajumbe wa kamati watapaswa waeleze wazi kwamba maoni hayo ni ya mbunge binafsi na siyo ya bunge wala kamati au kambi rasmi ya walio wachache bungeni
kanuni za kudumu za bunge utoaji wa taarifa baada kikao cha kamati 
 pale ambapo waziri anakutana na kamati kwenye vikao vilivyopangwa na inapotokea anakutana na waandishi wa habari baada ya kikao cha kamati waziri huyo atakuwa huru kutoa maoni kuhusiana na jambo lililoshughulikiwa kwenye kamati
 mwenyekiti wa kamati au msemaji wa kambi rasmi ya walio wachache bungeni inapotokea anakutana na waandishi wa habari atakuwa huru kutolea maoni jambo lolote lililofanyiwa kazi kwenye kamati pale mbapo kamati imekutana kushughulikia jambo fulani
 maoni yatakayotolewa chini ya fasili ya au ya hayatahusu uamuzi uliotolewa na kamati utakaowasilishwa bungeni
 kwa madhumuni ya anuni hii utaandaliwa utaratibu wa kawaida wa namna wenye viti wa kamati watakavyok uwa wanakutana na waandishi wa abari kuzungumzia shughuli itakayotekelezwa au iliyotekelezwa na kamati na maelezo hayo yanayotolewa kwenye vyombo vya habari kwa namna yoyote yasiwe ni mapendekezo ambayo kamati imeazimia kuyawasi lisha bungeni na ambayo yanaweza kuathiri maamuzi hayo
 endapo itatokea jambo ambalo lina maslahi kwa umma na wananchi wanataka maelezo mwenyekiti wa kamati atakuwa na uhuru wa kutoa maelezo ya jumla ili mradi maelezo hayo hayatahusiana na maamuzi ya kamati yatakayowasilishwa bungeni
kanuni za kudumu za bunge sehemu ya nne ukiukwaji wa masharti ya mwongozo ukiukwaji wa kanuni

viii uendelezaji wa teknolojia na utafiti

hadi sasa tayari mashine imekamilika kwa asilimia

mheshimiwa spika katika mwaka wa fedha wakala wa majengo tanzania uli panga kumaliz ia ujenzi wa nyumba za majaji tanzania bara katika mikoa ya dar es salaam kilimanjaro kagera mtwara shinyanga na tabora kuendelea na ujenzi wa nyumba za makazi magomeni kota ujenzi wa nyumba za viongozi dodoma nyumba za watumishi mikoa mipya pamoja na ujenzi wa nyumba ya makazi kwenye ikulu ya chamwino dodoma

 bodi ya usajili wa wahandisi 
mheshimiwa spika katika mwaka wa fedha bodi imepanga kusajili wahandisi mafundi sanifu na kampuni za ushauri wa kihandisi

uchaguzi wa serikali za mitaa wa mwaka
